item.title: Lab 3: Moderation
item.description: library(knitr) #include_graphics() library(equatiomatic) # extract_eq() library(psych) #describe() library(gtsummary) #tbl_summary() library(summarytools) #descr() library(stargazer) #stargazer() library(sjPlot) #tab_model() library(interactions) #interact_plot(), sim_slopes() library(jtools) #summ() library(tidyverse) Moderation When the research hypotheses state that different categories, or levels of another variable, may have differing responses to other independent variables, we need to use interaction terms - Also called moderation Example: The relationship between discrimination and grades depends on prog. Graph drawn using draw.io. Moderation Example Suppose you are doing a simple study on weight loss and notice that people who spend more time exercising lose more weight.
